passages.text: Latin America | Retailers C&A MODAS
Equity Research August 28, 2025

We are hosting a virtual group meeting with Laurence Gomes (CFO) today, Thursday, 28 August, 10.00am EST | 11.00am BRT | 15.00pm BST. C&A began operating in Brazil in 1976 and currently has more than 300 stores in 125 cities across the country. C&A has been consistently gaining share, leading 'value for money' consumer perceptions, leveraging on superior data analytics and dynamic pricing. Registration here

Energia C&A: Strong execution, more to come. The core objective of the Energia C&A strategic plan is to increase sales per sqm and productivity, through product innovation, quality improvement and category renovation, store remodeling, new format launch and expansion, and brand investment. 2024 was the first year of Energia C&A focused on strengthening the product, improving client experience, relationship and interaction. In 2025, C&A has intensified the execution of its 40 Energia C&A initiatives across the three blocks, a plan that will last until the end of 2026.

Renovation and growth. C&A has initiated a renovation plan across its store network, with 20 to 30 stores planned this year. In 2024, the company renovated 7 stores as a test, that resulted in sales per sqm at a double- digit level above average stores. C&A has intensified store reforms that will continue over coming years at a similar pace. C&A opened 5 stores this year (with another 3 planned for 2H), with above av. productivity levels, and is currently finalizing a new store format that will be launched this year. C&A will initially test 5 stores with the new format in 2H25 aiming to accelerate to 15 to 25 new stores per year from 2026. There are more than 100 locations mapped where C&A could potentially open new stores.

Momentum remains positive. There have been no signs of deceleration or deterioration in terms of traffic and conversion at C&A stores, despite stronger comps and competition (Asean platforms, H&M, Zara). C&A's products are discretionary, but with low- value ticket, and the company has been growing above peers. C&A aims to maintain competitiveness and not change its price positioning relative to Renner and Hering, with an average price \(10\%\) lower than its direct competitors. Future margin improvements are expected from dynamic pricing algorithms, logistics enhancements, and assortment optimization, reducing markdowns and boosting full- price sales.

Another strong quarter. SS3 growth at \(17\%\) in 2Q25 (cons. \(13\%\) in 2Q, \(15\%\) in 1Q25), despite strong comps, with net revenues up \(12\%\) to R\\$2,058m on lower non apparel sales and consumer finance, and EBITDA (post IFRS16) up \(22\%\) yoy R\\$438m, and net earnings at R\\$124m, up \(115\%\) \(8\%\) above. Net debt was down \(7\%\) yoy with leverage at 0.3x EBITDA.

C&A ends Bradesco partnership. C&A ended the partnership with Bradesco, which started in 2009, when the back bought lib and signed an agreement for the exclusive sale of its financial products in the retail network for 20 years. In 2021, C&A announced the repurchase of the right to offer financial services and products previously operated exclusively by Bradesco across its network for R\\$415m. C&A also sold a portfolio of Bradescard- branded credit cards for R\\$170m.

Management and board. A very experienced management team with well respected CEO Paulo Correa and CFO Laurence Beltrao Gomes (joined June 2023, ex Renner CFO at the time of Jose Gallo as CEO), and a team of independent board members largely represented by top managers of leading Brazilian companies. Chairman Marcos Grasso has a long international business experience in consumer goods across Asia, Europe and Latin America.

C&A was founded in 1841 by the Dutch brothelements e August. C&A started operations in Brazil in 1976 and currently has more than 300 stores in 125 cities across the country. Data analytics has been a key differentiator to grow sales density. The company has mapped 120 potential new stores in smaller cities for organic expansion.

Our price target for C&A implies 12x 2027E PER and 5x EV/EBITDA, reflecting the cost of equity in Brazil. Key risks include macro conditions, including GDP growth, inflation and unemployment levels, cost of risk in consumer finance, the proliferation of Asian e- commerce platforms and changes in consumer behavior and preferences.
For Important Disclosure information on companies recommended in this report, please visit our website at https://javatar.bluematrix.com/sellside/Disclosures.action or call 212.284.2300.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)

Explanation of Jefferies RatingsBuy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies. CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
